001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.lang.System.Logger.Level;
004import java.net.URI;
005import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007import java.util.Arrays;
008import java.util.Comparator;
009import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
010import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
011import java.util.List;
012import java.util.Locale;
013import java.util.Map;
014import java.util.Objects;
015import java.util.Properties;
016import java.util.Set;
017import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
018import java.util.function.BiFunction;
019import java.util.function.Function;
020import java.util.function.Supplier;
021import java.util.regex.Matcher;
022import java.util.regex.Pattern;
023
024import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
025
026import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogAppender.AppenderFlag;
027import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig.ChangePublisher.ChangeType;
028import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.Builder.AbstractLogProperties;
029import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.FoundProperty.ListProperty;
030import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.FoundProperty.MapProperty;
031import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.FoundProperty.StringProperty;
032import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.MutableLogProperties;
033import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.CaseChanging;
034import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.LogConfigurable;
035
036/**
037 * Provides String based properties like {@link System#getProperty(String)} for default
038 * configuration of logging levels and output. Since Rainbow Gum is configuration agnostic
039 * LogProperties is a simple string key and string value interface to allow almost any
040 * configuration implementation. The only required method to implement is
041 * {@link #valueOrNull(String)} and thus LogProperties is a functional like interface but
042 * using {@link LogProperties#builder()} is preferred so that a
043 * {@linkplain #description(String) description} can be added.
044 * <p>
045 * If a custom {@link LogProperties} is not configured the default RainbowGum uses System
046 * properties.
047 * <p>
048 * The built-in properties to configure RainbowGum are modeled after <a href=
049 * "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/3.1.0/reference/html/features.html#features.logging">
050 * Spring Boot logging </a>
051 * <p>
052 * LogProperties should generally be accessed with the {@link LogProperty.PropertyGetter}
053 * and {@link LogProperty.Property} like-monads which will allow safe
054 * <em>programmatic</em> data conversion of the flat key values and useful error messages
055 * to users if the property cannot be mapped or is missing. For more <em>declarative</em>
056 * injection of properties see {@link LogConfigurable} which will generate builders that
057 * can use LogProperties.
058 * <p>
059 * Rainbow Gum treats {@value #SEP} in the keys as special separator analogous to
060 * JavaScript/JSON and various other configuration systems. Furthermore to work with a
061 * wide set of configuration systems once a property key has a value it is
062 * <strong>RECOMMENDED</strong> that there should not be other property key value with a
063 * key that is a prefix of the previously mentioned key. For example allowing two
064 * properties <code>logging.example=stuff</code>, <code>logging.example.a=A</code> is not
065 * recommended as <code>logging.example</code> is defined as a leaf. The exception to this
066 * rule is logging levels mapped to logger names for consistency with Spring Boot.
067 * <p>
068 * Rainbow Gum out of the the box supports parsing two formats into properties:
069 * {@link Properties} text, and {@link URI#getRawQuery()} percent encoded query
070 * parameters. The two different formats have different behavior for
071 * {@link #listOrNull(String)} and {@link #mapOrNull(String)}. If a custom format of
072 * LogProperties is created those two methods may need to be extended.
073 * <p>
074 * A convention used through out Rainbow Gum is to have the property names as constants as
075 * it makes documentation easier. These constants name are suffixed with
076 * <code>_PROPERTY</code> or <code>_PREFIX</code> the former being a fully qualified key
077 * that maybe parameterized and the latter being a partial key ending with
078 * "<code>.</code>". The fully qualified keys are like leaves on a tree.
079 * <p>
080 * Property keys can be parameterized by using
081 * {@link LogProperties#interpolateKey(String, Map)} and a general pattern is
082 * <code>logging.component.{name}.prop</code> where {@value #NAME} is a parameter. Many
083 * property constants use this to allow multiple configuration of components by name.
084 *
085 * <table class="table">
086 * <caption><strong>Built-in Property Patterns</strong></caption>
087 * <tr>
088 * <th>Property Pattern</th>
089 * <th>Description</th>
090 * </tr>
091 * <tr>
092 * <td>{@value #LEVEL_PREFIX} + {@value #SEP} + logger = LEVEL</td>
093 * <td>Sets the level for the logger. If logger name is missing then it is considered the
094 * root logger. {@link Level#INFO} is the default level for the root logger.</td>
095 * </tr>
096 * <tr>
097 * <td>{@value #CHANGE_PREFIX} + {@value #SEP} + logger = boolean |
098 * List&lt;{@link ChangeType}&gt;</td>
099 * <td>Allows runtime changing of levels for the logger. By design RainbowGum does not
100 * allow loggers to change levels once initialized. This configuration will allow the
101 * level to be changed for the logger and its children and by default is false as the
102 * built-in {@link LogProperties} is generally static (system properties).</td>
103 * </tr>
104 * <tr>
105 * <td>{@value #ROUTES_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
106 * <td>A comma separated list of routes that should be enabled. If not set
107 * {@value LogRouter.Router#DEFAULT_ROUTER_NAME } is the default.</td>
108 * </tr>
109 * <tr>
110 * <td>{@value #ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
111 * <td>A comma separated list of appenders associated with the route. If not set
112 * {@value #APPENDERS_PROPERTY} is used.</td>
113 * </tr>
114 * <tr>
115 * <td>{@value #ROUTE_PUBLISHER_PROPERTY} = <code>URI</code></td>
116 * <td>Looks up a publisher by URI scheme using the {@link LogPublisherRegistry}. The
117 * publisher is then configured by properties with {@value #PUBLISHER_PREFIX}.</td>
118 * </tr>
119 * <tr>
120 * <td>{@value #APPENDERS_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
121 * <td>A comma separated list of appenders that should be enabled. If not set
122 * {@value LogAppender#CONSOLE_APPENDER_NAME} is the default.</td>
123 * </tr>
124 * <tr>
125 * <td>{@value #APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY } = <code>URI</code></td>
126 * <td>Looks up an output by URI scheme using the {@link LogOutputRegistry}. The output is
127 * then configured by properties with {@value #OUTPUT_PREFIX}.</td>
128 * </tr>
129 * <tr>
130 * <td>{@value #APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY } = <code>URI</code></td>
131 * <td>Looks up an encoder by URI scheme using the {@link LogEncoderRegistry}. The encoder
132 * is then configured by properties with {@value #ENCODER_PREFIX}.</td>
133 * </tr>
134 * <tr>
135 * <tr>
136 * <td>{@value #OUTPUT_PREFIX} + <code>propertyName</code></td>
137 * <td>Configures the named output. The name of the output usually comes from the
138 * appender.</td>
139 * </tr>
140 * <tr>
141 * <td>{@value #ENCODER_PREFIX} + <code>propertyName</code></td>
142 * <td>Configures the named encoder. The name of the encoder usually comes from the
143 * appender.</td>
144 * </tr>
145 * <tr>
146 * <td>{@value #FILE_PROPERTY} = URI</td>
147 * <td>A URI or file path to log to a file. This is for Spring Boot compatibility.</td>
148 * </tr>
149 * </table>
150 *
151 * @see LogConfigurable
152 */
153public interface LogProperties {
154
155        /**
156         * properties separator.
157         */
158        static final String SEP = ".";
159
160        /**
161         * Logging properties prefix.
162         */
163        static final String ROOT_PREFIX = "logging" + SEP;
164
165        /**
166         * Logging level properties prefix. The value should be the name of a
167         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level level}.
168         */
169        static final String LEVEL_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "level";
170
171        /**
172         * Enabled level groups. The value should be a list of group names used on
173         * {@link #GROUP_PROPERTY}. This is to enable <a href=
174         * "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.3.2/reference/features/logging.html#features.logging.log-groups">
175         * Spring Boot like Log Groups </a>. <em>Note that unlike Spring Boot groups are not
176         * enabled unless this property contains the group.</em>
177         */
178        static final String GROUPS_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "groups";
179
180        /**
181         * Group property with list of logger names. The level of the group is set with
182         * <code>{@value #LEVEL_PREFIX} + .{name} = Level</code> or on the router itself with
183         * <code>{@value #ROUTE_LEVEL_PREFIX} + .{name} = Level</code>. This is largely
184         * compatible with <a href=
185         * "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.3.2/reference/features/logging.html#features.logging.log-groups">
186         * Spring Boot Log Groups </a>.
187         * @see LevelResolver#parseLevel(String)
188         */
189        static final String GROUP_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "group.{name}";
190
191        /**
192         * Logging change configuration allowed property.
193         */
194        static final String GLOBAL_CHANGE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.change";
195
196        /**
197         * Will globally turn of any ANSI escape output as well disable extensions that do
198         * things for ANSI escape like JANSI.
199         */
200        static final String GLOBAL_ANSI_DISABLE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.ansi.disable";
201
202        /**
203         * IF true will provide additional output on errors.
204         */
205        static final String GLOBAL_VERBOSE = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.verbose";
206
207        /**
208         * Logging change properties prefix.
209         */
210        static final String CHANGE_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "change";
211
212        /**
213         * Logging file property for default single file appending. The value should be a URI.
214         */
215        static final String FILE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "file.name";
216
217        /**
218         * A common key parameter is called name.
219         */
220        static final String NAME = "name";
221
222        /**
223         * For properties keys that are parameterized with {@value #NAME} the name often used
224         * if not specified is: {@value #DEFAULT_NAME}.
225         */
226        static final String DEFAULT_NAME = "default";
227
228        /**
229         * Logging output prefix for configuration.
230         */
231        static final String OUTPUT_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "output.{" + NAME + "}.";
232
233        /**
234         * Logging output prefix for configuration.
235         */
236        static final String ENCODER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "encoder.{" + NAME + "}.";
237
238        /**
239         * Enabled Logging appenders. The value should be a list of names. This is equivalent
240         * to {@value #ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY} with name "default".
241         */
242        static final String APPENDERS_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "appenders";
243
244        /**
245         * Logging appender prefix for configuration.
246         */
247        static final String APPENDER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "appender.{" + NAME + "}.";
248
249        /**
250         * Output appender property.
251         */
252        static final String APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "output";
253
254        /**
255         * Encoder appender property.
256         */
257        static final String APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "encoder";
258
259        /**
260         * Appender flags. A list of flags (usually comma separated).
261         * @see AppenderFlag
262         */
263        static final String APPENDER_FLAGS_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "flags";
264
265        /**
266         * Logging publisher prefix for configuration.
267         */
268        static final String PUBLISHER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "publisher.{" + NAME + "}.";
269
270        /**
271         * Routes enabled with names comma separated.
272         */
273        static final String ROUTES_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "routes";
274
275        /**
276         * Route prefix for configuration.
277         */
278        static final String ROUTE_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "route.{" + NAME + "}.";
279
280        /**
281         * Logging publisher URI property.
282         */
283        static final String ROUTE_PUBLISHER_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "publisher";
284
285        /**
286         * Appenders associated with a route comma separated.
287         */
288        static final String ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "appenders";
289
290        /**
291         * Logging level properties prefix. The value should be the name of a
292         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level level}.
293         */
294        static final String ROUTE_LEVEL_PREFIX = ROUTE_PREFIX + "level";
295
296        /**
297         * Route flags.
298         */
299        static final String ROUTE_FLAGS_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "flags";
300
301        /**
302         * Analogous to {@link System#getProperty(String)}.
303         * @param key property name.
304         * @return property value.
305         */
306        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key);
307
308        /**
309         * Analogous to {@link System#getProperty(String, String)} with the exception that the
310         * fallback cannot be null and the return cannot be null.
311         * @param key property name.
312         * @param fallback returned if the value is not found and may not be null.
313         * @return value found or fallback.
314         */
315        default String value(String key, String fallback) {
316                Objects.requireNonNull(fallback);
317                String v = valueOrNull(key);
318                if (v != null) {
319                        return v;
320                }
321                return fallback;
322        }
323
324        /**
325         * Gets a list or null if the key is missing and by default uses
326         * {@link #parseList(String)}. The default implementation will parse the string value
327         * as a list using {@link LogProperties#parseList(String)} but custom implementations
328         * may rely on their own parsing or the data type is built-in to the backing
329         * configuration system.
330         * @param key property name.
331         * @return list or <code>null</code>.
332         * @apiNote the reason empty list is not returned for missing key is that it creates
333         * ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.
334         */
335        default @Nullable List<String> listOrNull(String key) {
336                String s = valueOrNull(key);
337                if (s == null) {
338                        return null;
339                }
340                return parseList(s);
341        }
342
343        /**
344         * Gets a map or null if the key is missing and by default uses
345         * {@link #parseMap(String)}. The default implementation will parse the string value
346         * as map using {@link LogProperties#parseMap(String)} but custom implementations may
347         * rely on their own parsing or the data type is built-in to the backing configuration
348         * system.
349         * @param key property name.
350         * @return map or <code>null</code>.
351         * @apiNote the reason empty map is not returned for missing key is that it creates
352         * ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.
353         */
354        default @Nullable Map<String, String> mapOrNull(String key) {
355                String s = valueOrNull(key);
356                if (s == null) {
357                        return null;
358                }
359                return parseMap(s);
360        }
361
362        /**
363         * Find <strong>string</strong> property or <code>null</code>.
364         * @param key property name.
365         * @return found property or <code>null</code>
366         */
367        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
368        default FoundProperty.@Nullable StringProperty stringPropertyOrNull(String key) {
369                String v = valueOrNull(key);
370                if (v != null) {
371                        return new FoundProperty.StringProperty(this, key, v);
372                }
373                return null;
374        }
375
376        /**
377         * Find <strong>list</strong> property or <code>null</code>.
378         * @param key property name.
379         * @return found property or <code>null</code>
380         */
381        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
382        default FoundProperty.@Nullable ListProperty listPropertyOrNull(String key) {
383                var v = listOrNull(key);
384                if (v != null) {
385                        return new FoundProperty.ListProperty(this, key, v);
386                }
387                return null;
388        }
389
390        /**
391         * Find <strong>map</strong> property or <code>null</code>.
392         * @param key property name.
393         * @return found property or <code>null</code>
394         */
395        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
396        default FoundProperty.@Nullable MapProperty mapPropertyOrNull(String key) {
397                var v = mapOrNull(key);
398                if (v != null) {
399                        return new FoundProperty.MapProperty(this, key, v);
400                }
401                return null;
402        }
403
404        /**
405         * Searches up a {@value #SEP} separated path using this properties to check for
406         * values. The first value not missing (not <code>null</code>) will be returned.
407         * @param <T> result type
408         * @param root prefix.
409         * @param key partial key that will have prefix concated on each try of func.
410         * @param func convert function where <code>null</code> return means to keep
411         * searching.
412         * @return closest value or <code>null</code> if no value can be found.
413         * @see #findUpPathOrNull(String, Function)
414         */
415        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
416        default <T extends @Nullable Object> @Nullable T findOrNull(String root, String key,
417                        BiFunction<LogProperties, String, @Nullable T> func) {
418                return findUpPathOrNull(key, k -> func.apply(this, concatKey(root, k)));
419        }
420
421        /**
422         * Describes a key and by default is usually just the key.
423         * @param key key.
424         * @return usually the key.
425         */
426        default String description(String key) {
427                return key;
428        }
429
430        /**
431         * When log properties are coalesced this method is used to resolve order. A higher
432         * number gives higher precedence.
433         * @return zero by default.
434         */
435        default int order() {
436                return 0;
437        }
438
439        /**
440         * Found property retrieved from {@link LogProperties}. This is a bridge and meta data
441         * needed for the {@link LogProperty} fluent like monads. It includes the original
442         * value before conversions.
443         *
444         * @apiNote This sealed class is purposely not generic parameterized but you are
445         * allowed to pattern match as the subclasses represent the builtin types of
446         * properties that are supported.
447         */
448        public sealed interface FoundProperty {
449
450                /**
451                 * The originating <em>exact</em> properties that the value was found on.
452                 * @return properties.
453                 */
454                LogProperties properties();
455
456                /**
457                 * The key that was used to find this property.
458                 * @return key also known as property name.
459                 */
460                String key();
461
462                /**
463                 * A string representation of the value that this property has usually for error
464                 * descriptions.
465                 * @return description of value.
466                 */
467                String valueDescription();
468
469                /**
470                 * A found <strong>string</strong> property result which includes the
471                 * <strong>exact</strong> properties where a value was found.
472                 *
473                 * @param properties the <strong>exact</strong> properties where the value was
474                 * found.
475                 * @param key property key.
476                 * @param value property string value.
477                 */
478                public record StringProperty(LogProperties properties, String key, String value) implements FoundProperty {
479                        @Override
480                        public String valueDescription() {
481                                return maybeRedact(value);
482                        }
483
484                        private static final Set<String> REDACTED_KEYS = Set.of("password", "apikey", "secret", "token");
485
486                        private static final String REDACTED_VALUE = "<REDACTED>";
487
488                        private static final String maybeRedact(String input) {
489                                String lower = input.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
490                                if (REDACTED_KEYS.contains(lower)) {
491                                        return REDACTED_VALUE;
492                                }
493                                for (var k : REDACTED_KEYS) {
494                                        if (input.contains(k)) {
495                                                return REDACTED_VALUE;
496                                        }
497                                }
498                                return input;
499                        }
500                }
501
502                /**
503                 * A found <strong>list</strong> property result which includes the
504                 * <strong>exact</strong> properties where a value was found.
505                 *
506                 * @param properties the <strong>exact</strong> properties where the value was
507                 * found.
508                 * @param key property key.
509                 * @param value property string value.
510                 */
511                public record ListProperty(LogProperties properties, String key, List<String> value) implements FoundProperty {
512                        @Override
513                        public String valueDescription() {
514                                return StringProperty.maybeRedact("" + value);
515                        }
516                }
517
518                /**
519                 * A found <strong>map</strong> property result which includes the
520                 * <strong>exact</strong> properties where a value was found.
521                 *
522                 * @param properties the <strong>exact</strong> properties where the value was
523                 * found.
524                 * @param key property key.
525                 * @param value property string value.
526                 */
527                public record MapProperty(LogProperties properties, String key,
528                                Map<String, String> value) implements FoundProperty {
529                        @Override
530                        public String valueDescription() {
531                                return StringProperty.maybeRedact("" + value);
532                        }
533                }
534
535        }
536
537        /**
538         * Abstract log properties builder.
539         *
540         * @param <T> builder.
541         * @apiNote this abstract class can largely be ignored hence why it is sealed.
542         */
543        public sealed abstract class AbstractBuilder<T> {
544
545                /**
546                 * description
547                 */
548                protected @Nullable String description = null;
549
550                /**
551                 * order
552                 */
553                protected int order = 0;
554
555                /**
556                 * rename key
557                 */
558                protected Function<String, String> renameKey = s -> s;
559
560                /**
561                 * fallbacks
562                 */
563                protected List<LogProperties> fallbacks = new ArrayList<>();
564
565                /**
566                 * Ignored.
567                 */
568                protected AbstractBuilder() {
569                }
570
571                /**
572                 * Add a fallback properties.
573                 * @param properties fallback not null.
574                 * @return this.
575                 */
576                public T with(LogProperties properties) {
577                        this.fallbacks.add(properties);
578                        return self();
579                }
580
581                /**
582                 * For returning this.
583                 * @return this builder.
584                 */
585                protected abstract T self();
586
587                /**
588                 * Description for properties.
589                 * @param description not null.
590                 * @return this.
591                 */
592                public T description(String description) {
593                        this.description = description;
594                        return self();
595                }
596
597                /**
598                 * When log properties are coalesced this method is used to resolve order. A
599                 * higher number gives higher precedence.
600                 * @param order order.
601                 * @return this.
602                 */
603                public T order(int order) {
604                        this.order = order;
605                        return self();
606                }
607
608                /**
609                 * Renames the key before it accesses function.
610                 * @param renameKey rename key function.
611                 * @return this.
612                 */
613                public T renameKey(Function<String, String> renameKey) {
614                        this.renameKey = renameKey;
615                        return self();
616                }
617
618                /**
619                 * Removes the prefix from a key before it accesses the underlying properties.
620                 * @param prefix to be removed from start of key.
621                 * @return this.
622                 */
623                public T removeKeyPrefix(String prefix) {
624                        return renameKey(k -> LogProperties.removeKeyPrefix(k, prefix));
625                }
626
627        }
628
629        /**
630         * Builder for properties.
631         */
632        public final static class Builder extends AbstractBuilder<Builder> {
633
634                private @Nullable Function<Builder, LogProperties> provider = null;
635
636                private Builder() {
637                }
638
639                @Override
640                protected Builder self() {
641                        return this;
642                }
643
644                private Builder provider(Function<Builder, LogProperties> provider) {
645                        if (this.provider != null) {
646                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("from already set");
647                        }
648                        this.provider = provider;
649                        return this;
650                }
651
652                /**
653                 * Sets what is called on {@link LogProperties#valueOrNull(String)}.
654                 * @param function valueOrNull func.
655                 * @return this.
656                 */
657                public Builder fromFunction(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Function<String, @Nullable String> function) {
658                        return provider((b) -> new DefaultLogProperties(function,
659                                        Objects.requireNonNullElse(description, "function"), renameKey, order));
660                }
661
662                /**
663                 * Parses a string as {@link Properties}.
664                 * @param properties properties as a string.
665                 * @return this.
666                 */
667                public Builder fromProperties(String properties) {
668                        if (description == null) {
669                                description = "PROPERTIES_STRING";
670                        }
671                        return fromFunction(PropertiesParser.readProperties(properties)::get);
672                }
673
674                /**
675                 * Parses a string as a URI query string. If the URI has no query portion then it
676                 * will be equivalent to empty properties.
677                 * @param uri percent encoded uri with separator as "<code>&amp;</code>" and key
678                 * value separator of "<code>=</code>".
679                 * @return this.
680                 */
681                public Builder fromURIQuery(URI uri) {
682                        String query = uri.getRawQuery();
683                        return provider(
684                                        (b) -> queryToProperties(query, Objects.requireNonNullElse(description, "URI_QUERY(" + uri + ")")));
685                }
686
687                /**
688                 * Parses a string as a URI query string.
689                 * @param query uri percent encoded uri with separator as "<code>&amp;</code>" and
690                 * key value separator of "<code>=</code>".
691                 * @return this.
692                 */
693                public Builder fromURIQuery(String query) {
694                        return provider((b) -> queryToProperties(query,
695                                        Objects.requireNonNullElse(description, "URI_QUERY(" + query + ")")));
696
697                }
698
699                private MultiMapProperties queryToProperties(@Nullable String query, String description) {
700                        Map<String, List<String>> multiMap;
701                        if (query == null) {
702                                multiMap = Map.of();
703                        }
704                        else {
705                                multiMap = parseMultiMap(query);
706                        }
707                        var properties = new MultiMapProperties(multiMap, description, renameKey, order);
708                        return properties;
709                }
710
711                /**
712                 * Builds LogProperties based on builder config.
713                 * @return this.
714                 */
715                public LogProperties build() {
716                        var f = this.provider;
717                        if (f == null) {
718                                if (!fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
719                                        return LogProperties.of(fallbacks);
720                                }
721                                throw new IllegalStateException("from was not set");
722                        }
723
724                        var first = f.apply(this);
725                        if (fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
726                                return first;
727                        }
728                        List<LogProperties> combined = new ArrayList<>();
729                        combined.add(first);
730                        combined.addAll(fallbacks);
731                        return LogProperties.of(combined);
732                }
733
734                static abstract class AbstractLogProperties implements LogProperties {
735
736                        protected final String description;
737
738                        protected final Function<String, String> renameKey;
739
740                        protected final int order;
741
742                        public AbstractLogProperties(String description, Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
743                                super();
744                                this.description = description;
745                                this.renameKey = renameKey;
746                                this.order = order;
747                        }
748
749                        @Override
750                        public int order() {
751                                return this.order;
752                        }
753
754                        @Override
755                        public String description(String key) {
756                                String rename = renameKey.apply(key);
757                                return description + "[" + rename + "]";
758                        }
759
760                        @Override
761                        public String toString() {
762                                return getClass().getSimpleName() + "[description='" + description + "', " + "order=" + order + "]";
763                        }
764
765                }
766
767                private static final class DefaultLogProperties extends AbstractLogProperties {
768
769                        private final Function<String, @Nullable String> func;
770
771                        public DefaultLogProperties(Function<String, @Nullable String> func, String description,
772                                        Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
773                                super(description, renameKey, order);
774                                this.func = func;
775                        }
776
777                        @Override
778                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
779                                return func.apply(renameKey.apply(key));
780                        }
781
782                }
783
784        }
785
786        /**
787         * A log properties that can be mutated like a map.
788         */
789        public interface MutableLogProperties extends LogProperties {
790
791                /**
792                 * Assigns key to a value.
793                 * @param key key.
794                 * @param value value if null will remove the key.
795                 * @return this.
796                 */
797                MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value);
798
799                /**
800                 * Copy java.util {@link Properties} String useful for unit testing.
801                 * @param content string in {@link Properties} format (tip use multiline strings).
802                 * @return this.
803                 */
804                default MutableLogProperties copyProperties(String content) {
805                        var m = PropertiesParser.readProperties(content);
806                        for (var e : m.entrySet()) {
807                                put(e.getKey(), e.getKey());
808                        }
809                        return this;
810                }
811
812                /**
813                 * Builder for MutableLogProperties.
814                 * @return builder.
815                 */
816                public static Builder builder() {
817                        return new Builder();
818                }
819
820                /**
821                 * Mutable Log properties builder.
822                 */
823                public final class Builder extends AbstractBuilder<Builder> {
824
825                        private Map<String, String> map = new LinkedHashMap<>();
826
827                        private Builder() {
828                        }
829
830                        @Override
831                        protected Builder self() {
832                                return this;
833                        }
834
835                        /**
836                         * Sets the backing mutable map.
837                         * @param map backing map.
838                         * @return this.
839                         */
840                        public Builder with(Map<String, String> map) {
841                                this.map = map;
842                                return this;
843                        }
844
845                        /**
846                         * Parses a string as {@link Properties} useful for unit testing with Java
847                         * multiline string literal.
848                         * @param properties properties as a string.
849                         * @return this.
850                         */
851                        public Builder copyProperties(String properties) {
852                                map.putAll(PropertiesParser.readProperties(properties));
853                                return this;
854                        }
855
856                        /**
857                         * Builds a mutable log properties.
858                         * @return mutable log properties.
859                         */
860                        public MutableLogProperties build() {
861                                String description = this.description;
862                                if (description == null) {
863                                        description = "custom mutable";
864                                }
865                                var first = new MapLogProperties(map, description, renameKey, order);
866                                if (fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
867                                        return first;
868                                }
869                                List<LogProperties> combined = new ArrayList<>();
870                                combined.add(first);
871                                combined.addAll(fallbacks);
872                                return new CompositeMutableLogProperties(sort(combined));
873                        }
874
875                        private static final class MapLogProperties extends LogProperties.Builder.AbstractLogProperties
876                                        implements MutableLogProperties {
877
878                                private final Map<String, String> map;
879
880                                public MapLogProperties(Map<String, String> map, String description, Function<String, String> renameKey,
881                                                int order) {
882                                        super(description, renameKey, order);
883                                        this.map = map;
884                                }
885
886                                @Override
887                                public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
888                                        return map.get(renameKey.apply(key));
889                                }
890
891                                @Override
892                                public MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value) {
893                                        Objects.requireNonNull(key);
894                                        key = renameKey.apply(key);
895                                        if (value == null) {
896                                                map.remove(key);
897                                                return this;
898                                        }
899                                        map.put(key, value);
900                                        return this;
901                                }
902
903                        }
904
905                }
906
907        }
908
909        /**
910         * LogProperties builder.
911         * @return builder.
912         */
913        public static Builder builder() {
914                return new Builder();
915        }
916
917        /**
918         * Finds global properties by checking the currently bound rainbow gum and if not set
919         * use system properties. <strong>This method should be used sparingly and is
920         * preferred that you get the properties through a config instance instead.</strong>
921         * @return currently bound properties or system properties.
922         * @apiNote the intention of this method is to be used for ServiceLoader singleton
923         * components and other systems that maybe bound prior to rainbow gum loading that
924         * need to determine if they should be enabled.
925         */
926        public static LogProperties findGlobalProperties() {
927                return findGlobalProperties(() -> StandardProperties.SYSTEM_PROPERTIES);
928        }
929
930        /**
931         * Finds global properties by checking the currently bound rainbow gum and if not set
932         * use the supplier as the fallback. <strong>This method should be used sparingly and
933         * is preferred that you get the properties through a config instance
934         * instead.</strong>
935         * @param fallback supplier to use if no rainbow gum is bound.
936         * @return currently bound properties or fallback.
937         * @apiNote the intention of this method is to be used for ServiceLoader singleton
938         * components and other systems that maybe bound prior to rainbow gum loading that
939         * need to determine if they should be enabled.
940         */
941        public static LogProperties findGlobalProperties(Supplier<? extends LogProperties> fallback) {
942                var gum = RainbowGum.getOrNull();
943                if (gum != null) {
944                        return gum.config().properties();
945                }
946                return Objects.requireNonNull(fallback.get());
947        }
948
949        /**
950         * Creates log properties from many log properties.
951         * @param logProperties list of properties.
952         * @param fallback if the logProperties list is empty.
953         * @return log properties
954         */
955        public static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties, LogProperties fallback) {
956                if (logProperties.isEmpty()) {
957                        return fallback;
958                }
959                if (logProperties.size() == 1) {
960                        return Objects.requireNonNull(logProperties.get(0));
961                }
962                var array = sort(logProperties);
963                return new CompositeLogProperties(array);
964        }
965
966        private static LogProperties[] sort(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties) {
967                @SuppressWarnings("null") // TODO eclipse array issue
968                LogProperties[] array = logProperties.stream()
969                        .filter(p -> p != StandardProperties.EMPTY)
970                        .toArray(size -> new LogProperties[size]);
971                Arrays.sort(array, Comparator.comparingInt(LogProperties::order).reversed());
972                return array;
973        }
974
975        /**
976         * Creates log properties from many log properties.
977         * @param logProperties the list of properties.
978         * @return if the logProperties is empty {@link StandardProperties#EMPTY} will be
979         * used.
980         */
981        public static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties) {
982                return of(logProperties, StandardProperties.EMPTY);
983        }
984
985        /**
986         * Creates log properties from a URI query and provided properties. This is useful for
987         * URI based providers where the URI query is contributing properties for the plugin.
988         * @param uri query will be used to pull properties from using
989         * {@link #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)}.
990         * @param prefix part of the key that will stripped before accessing the URI
991         * properties.
992         * @param properties usually this is the properties coming from {@link LogConfig}.
993         * @return combined properties where properties is tried first than the URI query
994         * parameters.
995         */
996        public static LogProperties of(URI uri, String prefix, LogProperties properties) {
997                return of(uri, prefix, properties, null);
998        }
999
1000        /**
1001         * Creates log properties from a URI query and provided properties. This is useful for
1002         * URI based providers where the URI query is contributing properties for the plugin.
1003         * @param uri query will be used to pull properties from using
1004         * {@link #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)}.
1005         * @param prefix part of the key that will stripped before accessing the URI
1006         * properties.
1007         * @param properties usually this is the properties coming from {@link LogConfig}.
1008         * @param uriKey where the URI came from.
1009         * @return combined properties where properties is tried first than the URI query
1010         * parameters.
1011         */
1012        public static LogProperties of(URI uri, String prefix, LogProperties properties, @Nullable String uriKey) {
1013                /*
1014                 * TODO this should be integrated with the whole providers and registries.
1015                 */
1016                String propDesc = uriKey != null ? "[" + uriKey + "]->" : "";
1017                String description = propDesc + "URI(" + uri + ")";
1018                var uriProperties = LogProperties.builder()
1019                        .description(description)
1020                        .fromURIQuery(uri)
1021                        .renameKey(s -> LogProperties.removeKeyPrefix(s, prefix))
1022                        .build();
1023                return LogProperties.of(List.of(properties, uriProperties));
1024        }
1025
1026        /**
1027         * Parse a {@linkplain URI#getRawQuery() URI query} in <a href=
1028         * "https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-html5-20141028/forms.html#url-encoded-form-data">
1029         * application/x-www-form-urlencoded </a> format useful for parsing properties values
1030         * that have key values embedded in them. <strong>This parser unlike form encoding
1031         * uses <code>%20</code> for space as the data is coming from a URI.</strong>
1032         * @param query raw query component of URI.
1033         * @param consumer accept will be called for each entry and if key (left hand) does
1034         * not have a "<code>=</code>" following it the second parameter on the consumer
1035         * accept will be passed <code>null</code>.
1036         */
1037        public static void parseUriQuery(String query,
1038                        @SuppressWarnings("exports") BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
1039                parseUriQuery(query, true, consumer);
1040        }
1041
1042        /**
1043         * Parses a URI query formatted string to a Map.
1044         * @param query raw query component of URI.
1045         * @return decoded key values with last key winning over previous equal keys.
1046         * @see #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)
1047         */
1048        public static Map<String, String> parseMap(String query) {
1049                Map<String, String> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
1050                parseUriQuery(query, (k, v) -> {
1051                        if (v != null) {
1052                                m.put(k, v);
1053                        }
1054                });
1055                return m;
1056        }
1057
1058        /**
1059         * Parses a URI query for a multiple value map. The list values of the map maybe empty
1060         * if the query parameter does not have any values associated with it which would be
1061         * the case if there is a parameter (key) with no "<code>=</code>" following it. For
1062         * example the following would have three entries of <code>a,b,c</code> all with empty
1063         * list: <pre>
1064         * <code>
1065         * a&amp;b&amp;c&amp;
1066         * </code> </pre>
1067         * @param query raw query component of URI.
1068         * @return decoded key values with multiple keys grouped together in order found.
1069         * @see #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)
1070         */
1071        public static Map<String, List<String>> parseMultiMap(String query) {
1072                Map<String, List<String>> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
1073                BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> f = (k, v) -> {
1074                        List<String> list = Objects.requireNonNull(m.computeIfAbsent(k, _k -> new ArrayList<String>()));
1075                        if (v != null) {
1076                                list.add(v);
1077                        }
1078                };
1079                parseUriQuery(query, f);
1080                return m;
1081        }
1082
1083        /**
1084         * Parses a list of strings from a string that is <a href=
1085         * "https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-html5-20141028/forms.html#url-encoded-form-data">
1086         * percent encoded for escaping (application/x-www-form-urlencoded)</a> where the
1087         * separator can be either "<code>&amp;</code>" or "<code>,</code>".
1088         * <p>
1089         * An example would be using ampersand: <pre><code>
1090         *  "a&amp;b%20B&amp;c" -> ["a","b B","c"]
1091         *  </code> </pre> and comma: <pre><code>
1092         *  "a,b,c" -> ["a","b","c"]
1093         *  </code> </pre>
1094         * @param query the comma or ampersand delimited string that is in URI query format.
1095         * @return list of strings
1096         */
1097        public static List<String> parseList(String query) {
1098                List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();
1099                parseUriQuery(query, (k, v) -> list.add(k));
1100                return list;
1101        }
1102
1103        private static void parseUriQuery(String query, boolean decode, BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
1104                parseUriQuery(query, decode, "[&,]", consumer);
1105        }
1106
1107        private static void parseUriQuery(String query, boolean decode, String sep,
1108                        BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
1109                /*
1110                 * TODO default java split has issues but is very fast
1111                 */
1112                @SuppressWarnings("StringSplitter")
1113                String[] pairs = query.split(sep);
1114                for (String pair : pairs) {
1115                        int idx = pair.indexOf("=");
1116                        String key;
1117                        String value;
1118                        if (idx == 0) {
1119                                continue;
1120                        }
1121                        else if (idx < 0) {
1122                                key = pair;
1123                                value = null;
1124                        }
1125                        else {
1126                                key = pair.substring(0, idx);
1127                                value = pair.substring(idx + 1);
1128                        }
1129                        if (decode) {
1130                                key = PercentCodec.decode(key, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
1131                                if (value != null) {
1132                                        value = PercentCodec.decode(value, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
1133                                }
1134
1135                        }
1136                        if (key.isBlank()) {
1137                                continue;
1138                        }
1139                        consumer.accept(key, value);
1140                }
1141        }
1142
1143        /**
1144         * Common static log properties such as System properties ane environment variables.
1145         */
1146        @CaseChanging
1147        enum StandardProperties implements LogProperties {
1148
1149                /**
1150                 * Empty properties. The order is <code>-1</code>.
1151                 */
1152                EMPTY {
1153                        @Override
1154                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
1155                                return null;
1156                        }
1157
1158                        @Override
1159                        public int order() {
1160                                return -1;
1161                        }
1162                },
1163                /**
1164                 * Uses {@link System#getProperty(String)} for {@link #valueOrNull(String)}. The
1165                 * {@link #order()} is <code>400</code> which the same value as MicroProfile
1166                 * config ordinal.
1167                 */
1168                SYSTEM_PROPERTIES {
1169                        @Override
1170                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
1171                                return System.getProperty(key);
1172                        }
1173
1174                        @Override
1175                        public int order() {
1176                                return 400;
1177                        }
1178                },
1179                /**
1180                 * Uses {@link System#getenv(String)} for {@link #valueOrNull(String)}.The
1181                 * {@link #order()} is <code>300</code> which is the same value as MicroProfile
1182                 * config ordinal.
1183                 */
1184                ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLES {
1185                        @Override
1186                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
1187                                return System.getenv(translateKey(key));
1188                        }
1189
1190                        @Override
1191                        protected String translateKey(String key) {
1192                                return key.replace(".", "_");
1193                        }
1194
1195                };
1196
1197                @Override
1198                public String description(String key) {
1199                        String k = translateKey(key);
1200                        return name() + "[" + k + "]";
1201                }
1202
1203                /**
1204                 * Translate the key.
1205                 * @param key input
1206                 * @return output
1207                 */
1208                protected String translateKey(String key) {
1209                        return key;
1210                }
1211
1212        }
1213
1214        /**
1215         * Searches a {@value LogProperties#SEP} separated property path recursing up the path
1216         * till a non null value (not missing) is found.
1217         * <p>
1218         * For example assume we have a single property set like
1219         * <code>logging.level.com.stuff=DEBUG</code> and we call this function with
1220         * <code>logging.level.com.stuff.a.b</code>.
1221         * <ol>
1222         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff.a.b</code> will resolve to <code>null</code></li>
1223         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff.a</code> will resolve to <code>null</code></li>
1224         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff</code> will resolve to <code>"DEBUG"</code>, stop
1225         * and return <code>"DEBUG"</code>.</li>
1226         * </ol>
1227         * @param <T> type to return.
1228         * @param key the initial path.
1229         * @param resolveFunc function that returns the value at path or <code>null</code>.
1230         * @return value or <code>null</code> if no non null value can be found.
1231         */
1232        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
1233        public static <T extends @Nullable Object> @Nullable T findUpPathOrNull(String key,
1234                        Function<String, @Nullable T> resolveFunc) {
1235                return searchPath(key, resolveFunc, SEP);
1236        }
1237
1238        private static <T> @Nullable T searchPath(String key, Function<String, @Nullable T> resolveFunc, String sep) {
1239                String tempName = key;
1240                @Nullable
1241                T level = null;
1242                int indexOfLastDot = tempName.length();
1243                while ((level == null) && (indexOfLastDot > -1)) {
1244                        tempName = tempName.substring(0, indexOfLastDot);
1245                        level = resolveFunc.apply(tempName);
1246                        indexOfLastDot = tempName.lastIndexOf(sep);
1247                }
1248                if (level != null) {
1249                        return level;
1250                }
1251                return resolveFunc.apply("");
1252        }
1253
1254        /**
1255         * Concats a key using {@link #SEP} to the root prefix.
1256         * @param name key.
1257         * @return concat key.
1258         */
1259        static String concatKey(String name) {
1260                return concatKey(LogProperties.ROOT_PREFIX, name);
1261        }
1262
1263        /**
1264         * Concats a keys using {@link #SEP} as the separator.
1265         * @param prefix start of key.
1266         * @param name second part of key.
1267         * @return key.
1268         */
1269        static String concatKey(String prefix, String name) {
1270                if (name.equals("")) {
1271                        return prefix;
1272                }
1273                if (prefix.equals("")) {
1274                        return name;
1275                }
1276                if (prefix.endsWith(".")) {
1277                        prefix = prefix.substring(0, prefix.length() - 1);
1278                }
1279                if (name.startsWith(SEP)) {
1280                        return prefix + name;
1281                }
1282                return prefix + SEP + name;
1283        }
1284
1285        /**
1286         * Replace "{name}" tokens in property names.
1287         * @param key property name.
1288         * @param parameters tokens to replace with entry values.
1289         * @return interpolated property key.
1290         * @see #interpolateKey(String, Function)
1291         */
1292        static String interpolateKey(String key, Map<String, String> parameters) {
1293                return interpolateKey(key, parameters::get);
1294        }
1295
1296        /**
1297         * Replaces property <strong>key</strong> parameters by using the lookup function.
1298         * Property keys are often parameterized usually by some name. The parameters are
1299         * surrounded by curly braces and replaced by the lookup function. An example of the
1300         * format is <code>a.{PARAM}</code> which has a parameter named <code>PARAM</code>. If
1301         * the lookup function has <code>PARAM->b</code> then the result will be
1302         * <code>a.b</code>. If a value for a parameter is null (indicates not found) an
1303         * exception is thrown.
1304         * @param key to be interpolated.
1305         * @param lookup function that may return null for a parameter.
1306         * @return interpolated key with all parameters replaced.
1307         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the lookup function does not have a value for a
1308         * parameter.
1309         */
1310        public static String interpolateKey(String key,
1311                        @SuppressWarnings("exports") Function<String, ? extends @Nullable String> lookup)
1312                        throws IllegalArgumentException {
1313                var parameters = keyParameters(key);
1314                String result = key;
1315                for (String k : parameters) {
1316                        var v = lookup.apply(k);
1317                        if (v == null) {
1318                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1319                                                "Keyed parameter missing. key: '" + key + "' parameter: '" + k + "'");
1320                        }
1321                        result = result.replace("{" + k + "}", v);
1322                }
1323                return result;
1324        }
1325
1326        /**
1327         * Interpolates a named key which is a property key that has a {@value #NAME}.
1328         * @param key with name parameters.
1329         * @param name replace name token.
1330         * @return interpolated property key.
1331         */
1332        static String interpolateNamedKey(String key, String name) {
1333                return interpolateKey(key, Map.of(NAME, name));
1334        }
1335
1336        /**
1337         * Remove key prefix from the key. Prefix should end in "." but this method does not
1338         * check that.
1339         * @param key key whose prefix will be removed.
1340         * @param prefix property name prefix.
1341         * @return prefix removed if the string is prefixed.
1342         */
1343        static String removeKeyPrefix(String key, String prefix) {
1344                if (key.startsWith(prefix)) {
1345                        return key.substring(prefix.length());
1346                }
1347                return key;
1348        }
1349
1350        /**
1351         * Property prefix parameter pattern.
1352         */
1353        static final Pattern PARAMETER_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("\\{(.*?)\\}");
1354
1355        /**
1356         * Extract key parameters with {@link #PARAMETER_PATTERN}.
1357         * @param key also known as property name.
1358         * @return parameters in key.
1359         */
1360        static Set<String> keyParameters(String key) {
1361                Set<String> tokens = new LinkedHashSet<>();
1362                Matcher matcher = PARAMETER_PATTERN.matcher(key);
1363                while (matcher.find()) {
1364                        var t = matcher.group(1);
1365                        if (t == null) {
1366                                throw new IllegalStateException("bug with parameter pattern regex.");
1367                        }
1368                        tokens.add(t);
1369                }
1370                return tokens;
1371        }
1372
1373        /**
1374         * Validate key parameters.
1375         * @param key key to be interpolated with parameters.
1376         * @param parameters names of parameters which must <strong>equal</strong> the set of
1377         * the found parameters. while the order obviously does not matter the set cannot have
1378         * more parameters than found in the key.
1379         */
1380        static void validateKeyParameters(String key, Set<String> parameters) {
1381                var keyParameters = keyParameters(key);
1382                if (!parameters.equals(keyParameters)) {
1383                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Keyed parameter mismatch. key: '" + key + "' , key parameters: "
1384                                        + keyParameters + " provided parameters: " + parameters);
1385                }
1386        }
1387
1388}
1389
1390final class MultiMapProperties extends AbstractLogProperties {
1391
1392        private final Map<String, List<String>> multiMap;
1393
1394        public MultiMapProperties(Map<String, List<String>> multiMap, String description,
1395                        Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
1396                super(description, renameKey, order);
1397                this.multiMap = multiMap;
1398        }
1399
1400        @Override
1401        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
1402                return _valueOrNull(renameKey.apply(key));
1403        }
1404
1405        private @Nullable String _valueOrNull(String key) {
1406                var list = multiMap.get(key);
1407                if (list == null || list.isEmpty()) {
1408                        return null;
1409                }
1410                return list.get(0);
1411        }
1412
1413        @Override
1414        public @Nullable List<String> listOrNull(String key) {
1415                return multiMap.get(renameKey.apply(key));
1416        }
1417
1418        @Override
1419        public @Nullable Map<String, String> mapOrNull(String key) {
1420                /*
1421                 * Now we check for dotted notation since key was not set. key.subkey=value
1422                 */
1423                String prefix = renameKey.apply(key) + LogProperties.SEP;
1424                LinkedHashMap<String, String> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
1425                for (var k : multiMap.keySet()) {
1426                        if (k.startsWith(prefix) && !k.equals(prefix)) {
1427                                String v = _valueOrNull(k);
1428                                if (v != null) {
1429                                        String _k = k.substring(prefix.length());
1430                                        m.put(_k, v);
1431                                }
1432                        }
1433                }
1434                return m;
1435        }
1436
1437}
1438
1439interface ListLogProperties extends LogProperties {
1440
1441        @Override
1442        default @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
1443                for (var props : properties()) {
1444                        var value = props.valueOrNull(key);
1445                        if (value != null) {
1446                                return value;
1447                        }
1448                }
1449                return null;
1450        }
1451
1452        @Override
1453        default @Nullable StringProperty stringPropertyOrNull(String key) {
1454                for (var props : properties()) {
1455                        var value = props.stringPropertyOrNull(key);
1456                        if (value != null) {
1457                                return value;
1458                        }
1459                }
1460                return null;
1461        }
1462
1463        @Override
1464        default @Nullable ListProperty listPropertyOrNull(String key) {
1465                for (var props : properties()) {
1466                        var value = props.listPropertyOrNull(key);
1467                        if (value != null) {
1468                                return value;
1469                        }
1470                }
1471                return null;
1472        }
1473
1474        @Override
1475        default @Nullable MapProperty mapPropertyOrNull(String key) {
1476                for (var props : properties()) {
1477                        var value = props.mapPropertyOrNull(key);
1478                        if (value != null) {
1479                                return value;
1480                        }
1481                }
1482                return null;
1483        }
1484
1485        @Override
1486        default String description(String key) {
1487                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
1488                boolean first = true;
1489                for (var p : properties()) {
1490                        if (first) {
1491                                first = false;
1492                        }
1493                        else {
1494                                sb.append(", ");
1495                        }
1496                        sb.append(p.description(key));
1497                }
1498                return sb.toString();
1499        }
1500
1501        LogProperties[] properties();
1502
1503        default StringBuilder toString(StringBuilder sb) {
1504                sb.append(getClass().getSimpleName());
1505                sb.append("[properties=").append(Arrays.deepToString(properties())).append("]");
1506                return sb;
1507        }
1508
1509}
1510
1511record CompositeMutableLogProperties(LogProperties[] properties) implements ListLogProperties, MutableLogProperties {
1512
1513        @Override
1514        public MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value) {
1515                for (var p : properties()) {
1516                        if (p instanceof MutableLogProperties mp && mp != this) {
1517                                mp.put(key, value);
1518                                return this;
1519                        }
1520                }
1521                return this;
1522        }
1523
1524        @Override
1525        public String toString() {
1526                return toString(new StringBuilder()).toString();
1527        }
1528
1529}
1530
1531record CompositeLogProperties(LogProperties[] properties) implements ListLogProperties {
1532        @Override
1533        public String toString() {
1534                return toString(new StringBuilder()).toString();
1535        }
1536}
